title: Front Fork - Disassembly

body.body: Front fork removal DC; DC3; DC4; DP; DP2; DP3; DP4; DPA

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DC4; DP4; DC3; DP3; DP2; DC; DPA; DP

body.body: If not already done, release the torque on the damping cylinder bolt, then lightly retighten it to prevent fluid loss.
, take great care not to over tighten the clamp as this will cause the fork tube to distort beyond repair.
It may be necessary to hold the damping cylinder using a proprietary fork damper holding tool when removing the damping cylinder bolt.
Remove the damping cylinder bolt and sealing washer from the base of the outer tube. Discard the sealing washer.

body.name: Front Fork Damper Rod Bolt fork_1

body.body: Invert the fork and remove the damping cylinder and rebound spring.
Ease the dust seal out of position and slide it off the inner tube.
Keep the fork fully compressed whilst removing the circlip. Any accidental damage to the inner tube will then be confined to the area which is normally above the oil seal.
Carefully ease the circlip out from the top of the outer tube.
Compress the fork then pull the inner tube sharply out of the outer tube. Repeat this procedure until the top bush and seal are forced out of position and the inner and outer tube can be separated.
Invert the outer tube and tip out the damper rod seat and its spring.
Slide the oil seal, washer and upper bush off the top of the inner tube.
Carefully slide the lower bush off the inner tube.
